intro: Alcea flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, upright stems and showy, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to greenish-yellow. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Alcea flavovirens typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
